reviewText: I may have missed something in the course description.  This is clearly designed for Hopkins students and has very limited appeal to the general public.  The content hardly corresponds to the course title.
Very basic known stuff. I didn't watch any of the videos and I just took the tests and I passed the course. It would be helpful if you have never left the country.
could have been more attractive and information got bored after a point of time less animation but huge content and background voice

Overall a very good course. As an "experienced" multilingual traveler, picked up on a few things, got a good refresher for other elements and will have a (slightly) different approach to traveling and working abroad. The personal tales brought back some memories of my own. No feedback from course instructors or fellow students, which was a bit disappointing. As such, I did not do the honors component as it would only be valuable if somebody would comment on it.
GREAT COURSE!
The course is informative on travel health. Why is is asking to PURCHASE CERTICATE.
Very helpful

Curso interesante, sobre todo para aquellos que estamos inmersos en la educación internacional. Muchas de las experiencias compartidas en el curso son parte de mis propias experiencias. Muy importante los temas de salud, bienestar y seguridad y sobre todo las cuestiones éticas. Me hubiera gustado también ver aspectos relacionados con los viajes de estudiantes en grupo con fines de investigación o cursos electivos.
Our instructor has been very specific and I like the way she explains everything.  The week 5 module is not boring the presentation has been very creative. Thank you Hopkins University! :D
Informative course for Travel consolers.
I Like it.
It was very useful
Best for the newly appointed foreign-country project or job holder.

The content was great, but the main lecturer didn't speak with appropriate feeling. If she could improve her vocal quality, I think it would be easier for students to focus. Still, she was decent, and overall I was quite satisfied with everything.
It was good
The course was pretty interesting and useful, just a bit "basic" some times (good to have the possibility to skip those parts) and Johns Hopkins' student-focused in some sections.
I learned a lot.

Overall great. However, judging by the discussion forums, most of the students are located in various places in the world outside of just the U.S.A. Therefore, it might be worth considering making the course contents more international or even providing some relevant materials for those outside of the U.S rather than consistently using the U.S. systems as prime examples. I realize this may be a difficult thing to do with any sense of overall equality, but it may be worth considering for future classes.
i like this course and hope it will get me job anywhere for travel the world
was a great way to learn the safety measures we should consider while travelling to foreign places

The course is definitely good for a first-time traveller outside the USA, but as I have lived in 10 countries and worked in around 20 more ina 35-year timespan, I learned little new information from this course.  It was fun taking it though.
users: Edward John Oliveros Rodriguez, CPA CIA CFE CNP CPP

it's  the best  course for those to travel to different countries, and people working with deferent cultural groups.

As someone who has traveled and lived abroad extensively, I wasn't sure if this course would have much to offer, but I was wrong! Aside from the very clear emphasis on grad students (which I am not) the general course information was very useful and enlightening- although I would say the emphasis on the dangers of travel might actually turn away potential study-abroad or work-abroad persons.
Very suitable course for beginner, especially for those ones who wanted to study online. I highly recommend this course to you guys.
An excellent course that prepares travelers in order not to be caught unaware.......it is highly recommended for existing and intending travelers.
This was a great overview and platform for more discussion at my institution. I really got a lot out of the course.

Great course with lots of helpful information. It is definitely geared towards international health students, however I have found it to be very informative as a language student.

This is course is very informative for those, who didn't start to travel oversea. From this, I learned what are the basics of things. I should keep in mind during travelings like medical insurance, visa and etc.
better course
it is an interesting course ... I really learned a lot
Good

I recommend this course to every individual who is planning for an international travel. It helps to prepare and plan about the various aspects needed to be taken care of, for a safe and successful journey. I personally learnt a lot of new things to be considered while staying alone and while working in groups. Also the learnings about cultural impact of our journey were an eye opener for me to give me fresh perspective. I am thankful to the creators of the course for initiating the idea of such curriculum and appreciate the efforts taken.

I work in a travel industry and i loved every bit of the course content.Very useful information about safety & precautions, preparations, handling unexpected situations while in a foreign nation has been brought out so well and this has helped broaden my scope of knoweldge in travel preparations.
very informative and interesting course
Really a very good course for travelers, or people who help students, tourists or workers who want to live abroad.
It was an amazing experience learning from Coursera and our mentor Anna Kalbarczyk who has helped me in various problems the one can face while traveling.

A travel enthusiast like me always wanted to learn more about travelling in a new culture. The things to be noted, the insurance and vaccinations to be taken before reaching so and so land was vital. Thank you for the knowledge shared. Stay Home and Stay Safe.A big Thank You to all who collected the details for the course. All the best.
The course is very interesting and helpful. I found a lot of concept and description. The video testimonial are important to understand the course.
I work in relocation and this course gave me a deeper understanding of how and what to explain to clients when moving to a new country. Thank you

This course has given the insight of most useful information about safety & precautions, preparations, handling unexpected situations while in a foreign nation. I am quite happy to recommend people of taking this course especially if you are planning for a long term or shifting to a new country.

Although I'm not from a health profession, I have decided on this course because I need more knowledge about travel preparation and the wellness and safety part of it all. I was very positively surprised by this course, it has exceeded my expectations. I wish the university in my home country was so good and rewarding.
